notes: On 14 December 2023, Somali pirates hijacked a large commercial ship, Ruen bulk carrier in the South Arabian Sea around 700 nautical miles off Somalia. The gunmen took control of the ship and sailed the ship and its crew to Somali waters in the Puntland region on 17 December. A Spanish warship and an Indian warship chased the pirates but failed to catch up. The incident represented the first capture of a large commercial vessel by Somali pirates since 2017 and took place amid increased maritime insecurity following Houthi drone and missile attacks targeting Israeli-linked ships in the Red Sea region and reports of deals between Houthi forces and Somali armed groups.

On 11 October 2023, Abgal clan militia shot and killed three businessmen of the same clan in between Labagaras and Ceel Muluq village (Cadale, Middle Shabelle). The motive was due to a sub-clan revenge.

On 11 October 2023, a group of Hawadle clan militia shot and killed a civilian from Habar Gedir Ayr clan over clan revenge in Matabaan village (Belet Weyne, Hiraan). Five people who were involved in the incident were arrested.

On 11 October 2023, overnight, Al Shabaab carried out a hit and run attack against government security forces (SNA) at the Xeero Kowad defensive base in Diinsoor town (Diinsoor, Bay). The attack was initiated with RPGs and followed by heavy exchange of gunfire. There were no casualties. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility.

On 11 October 2023, Al Shabaab ambushed government security forces (SNA) who were conducting an operation near Cali Fool Dheere town (Jowhar, Middle Shabelle). Al Shabaab claimed to have killed five soldiers and injured seven others.

notes: On 29 October 2022, two suicide vehicle-borne IEDs (SVBIED) by Al Shabaab detonated at the perimeter wall of the Ministry of Education targeting civilians at the KM4 area, Zoobe junction in Mogadishu - Hodan (Banadir). In total, over 121 people including government officials, journalists, a Hodan police commander (off duty), business owners and two suicide bombers were killed. Over 300 other people were injured. Al Shabaab claimed targeting the Ministry of Education for its role in the offensive and the curriculum against Al Shabaab ideologies.

On 30 September 2022, Al Shabaab ambushed a government security forces (SNA) convoy near Jambaluul village (Afgooye, Lower Shabelle). The clash was initiated with RPGs and followed by an exchange of heavy gunfire from both sides. Al Shabaab claimed killing seven soldiers and injuring several others. The ambush came after the police forces took over the village earlier and the SNA were on their way to the near base.

On 29 September 2022, two groups of Hawadle clan militia clashed over land in Darwish market in the Koshin neighborhood in Belet Weyne town (Belet Weyne, Hiiran). Two people were killed and three others were injured.

On 3 January 2022, Al Shabaab militants fired five mortar shells against Ethiopian security forces (non-AMISOM) and government security forces (SNA) bases in Waajid town (Waajid, Bakool). There were no casualties. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility.
On 3 January 2022, police officer shot and killed a tuk-tuk driver at the Ex-control Afgooye in Mogadishu - Daynile (Banadir).

On 2 January 2022, several local residents demonstrated against the government security forces (SNA) and Hirshabelle administration for attacking Abukar Haji Warsame Xuud and Nur Dheere militia at the Ceel Gaal and Buurto Qowleed area, disrupted the flow of people and vehicles, barricading road with stones, chanting slogans against the governor of Hiran and Hirshabelle in Belet Weyne town (Belet Weyne, Hiraan).

On 2 January 2022, Dhulbahante-Hassan Ugaas sub-clan militia clashed with Majeerteen-Isse Mohamud sub-clan militia in Salaax Maygaag village near Boocame town (Laas Caanood, Sool). At least 20 people were killed. The motive of the clash is due to land dispute.

assoc_actor_1: Police Forces of Somalia (2017-2022) Hirshabelle Police Forces
notes: On 2 January 2022, government security forces (SNA) and Hirshabelle police attacked Abukar Haji Warsame Xuud and Nur Dheere militias in Ceel Gaal village (Belet Weyne, Hiraan). Four people were killed and ten others were injured. Hiraan governor was part of the operation. The clan militia are opposing Hirshabelle administration.
On 2 January 2022, Al Shabaab militants shot and killed a clan elder in Buur Xakaba town (Buur Hakaba, Bay). Al Shabaab claimed responsibility.

actor2: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-2022) Special Forces
notes: On 2 January 2022, a remote controlled IED by Al Shabaab militants detonated, targeting a government security forces (Danab/Bancroft) vehicle travelling between Dhuusamarreeb and Ceel Dheer village (Dhuusamarreeb, Galgaduud). Nine soldiers were killed and three others were injured. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility.

actor2: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-2022) (Uganda)
notes: On 2 January 2022, a remote controlled IED by Al Shabaab militants detonated, targeting an AMISOM UPDF convoy travelling on Mogadishu -Afgooye road, near the custodian corps building around Ex-control Afgooye in Mogadishu - Daynile (Banadir). There were no casualties.

On 2 January 2022, Al Shabaab militants carried out an attack against government security forces (SNA) at a defensive on the bridge in Janaale (Marka, Lower Shabelle). The fighting was initiated with RPG followed by an exchange of heavy gunfire. There were no casualties.

On 2 January 2022, Al Shabaab militants carried out an attack against government security forces (SNA) at a defensive base in Almada village (Afgooye, Lower Shabelle). The fighting was initiated with RPG followed by an exchange of heavy gunfire. There were no casualties.

actor2: Police Forces of Somalia (2017-2022) Jubaland Security Force
notes: On 1 January 2022, unidentified gunmen threw a hand grenade at the Dhobley police station in Dhobley town (Afmadow, Lower Juba). There were no casualties.

actor2: Police Forces of Somalia (2017-2022) Southwest Special Police Forces
notes: On 1 January 2022, Al Shabaab militants carried out a hit and run attack against the Southwest Special Police Forces (SWSPF) at a base in Qansax Dheere town (Qansax Dheere, Bay). One militant was killed.

On 1 January 2022, a remote controlled IED by Al Shabaab militants detonated, targeting an Ethiopia forces water tanker (non-AMISOM) travelling along the Kalabeyr-Feerfeer road, in the vicinity of Feerfeer village (Belet Weyne, Hiraan). Al Shabaab claimed ten soldiers were killed and 15 others injured.

On 1 January 2022, a suicide bomber using an UVIED suspected to be from Al Shabaab militants detonated, at Bar-Ubah intersection in Mogadishu - Hawl Wadaag (Banadir). The driver died in the blast and two bystanders sustained serious injuries.

Defusal: On 1 January 2022, government security forces (SNA) in an operation defused an IED planted by Al Shabaab militants, along the road between Daniga and Baasra village (Afgooye, Lower Shabelle).

On 1 January 2022, security forces [assumed police] loyal to the deputy political chairman of Deynile district and sector chairman of Daru-Salaam neighborhood engaged in an exchange of heavy gunfire in Mogadishu - Daynile (Banadir). Five people were killed and others were injured. The reason behind the fighting was over a land dispute.

actor2: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-2022) (Uganda)
notes: On 1 January 2022, an IED by Al Shabaab militants detonated, targeting an AMISOM UPDF convoy in Ceel Waregow village (Marka, Lower Shabelle). Al Shabaab claimed six soldiers were killed.
